name: Bond Place Hotel

reviews.title: Very nice
reviews.text: I satyed at this hotel for 1 week as i was traverling though canada and america, The staff were very nice, the hotel is very clean and in excellent location, i would return tomorrow if i could. They also offer trips in this hotel i did them all and had a very fab time.

If you are simply looking for an inexpensive, clean and comfortable place to stay for a few days, especially if you are going to Toronto to shop, this hotel is for you! Literally, this hotel is located across the street from Eaton Centre, close to the boutiques on Bloor Street and close to the clubs on Richmond Ave. The staff were very friendly. I asked for a iron to be brought to my room and it was delivered in less than 5 minutes. The rooms were very clean, towels and sheets were changed daily. The shower was very clean and had great water pressure. Beds were comfortable. I would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Clean, Convenient, Cheap - Exactly what I needed!

reviews.text: The location is great. I walked just about everywhere. Bloor/Yonge intersection is about a 15-20 minute walk. There are many stores and restaurants and even a mall in the immediate area.
reviews.title: I'd stay again
location location location
reviews.text: The room itself was small, the bed was extra firm, and the air conditioner didn't cool the room well. But the staff was friendly, everything was clean & I felt safe in the area.
If you just want a place to rest, shower, & save some money, this is the best place I found. But if you want luxury, this is not it.
reviews.title: Handy for the Eaton Centre and TTC
Watch out
reviews.text: I was looking for a place just OK to stay a few days, and in terms of accomodations it is barely OK. However, be aware that they will try to charge you those side, minor, services unfair prices. I was charged for watching a film on TV CDN12 !! The room daily charge was CDN75, how can a movie cost 12?! On top of that they charged twice the movies! Another example: the ride to the airport, the luggage carrier was too interested in booking a taxi for CDN45, when there was a bus shuttle for CDN16 which he "accidently" forgot to mention. I will never return and I do not recomend.
I stayed in this Hotel for a week. The airport express bus has its drop-off/pick-up stop at the door of the hotel.
reviews.title: Great location for downtown Toronto
not really good
reviews.text: My room was a good size, clean, comfortable and great value for money. Location was ideal, with the subway and Eaton shopping centre just a few minutes walk from the hotel and it took, around, 20-30 minutes to walk to the CN Tower.

reviews.title: Excellent Value
reviews.text: Last, but not least, I found the staff to be most helpful.
Not the best hotel ive been in my life. Its quite old, needs big big investment.
reviews.title: excellent!!

reviews.text: The Bond Place Hotel was a great place to stay for 3-4 nights. The location is great. It's a very short walk to the Eaton Centre shopping mall. It takes a bit longer to walk to the CN Tower and the Distillery District.
reviews.title: Location Location Location

reviews.text: The room was a good size and there was a good selection of TV channels! Room was clean and comfortable, but wasn't by any means luxurious, but for the price, it was great.
reviews.title: Great location and value for money

reviews.text: One of the best things about the hotel was the concierge service. On my first day, I was told about the day trip to Niagara and the time it left and bought my ticket from the concierge on the day of the trip. On another day, being a New Zealander, I wanted to watch the All Blacks play a rugby union game against Wales. Even though the concierge on duty didn't really know much about rugby (he was Canadian after all), he managed to find me a bar to watch the game in - and it only took him about 5 minutes. He was also really good at suggesting things to do and where nearby facilities were (e.g. places to have breakfast, where to get internet access etc).
reviews.title: recomend this hotel
Great Location and Value
reviews.text: All in all, the Bond Place Hotel was a great place to stay. It's easy to find somewhere to eat nearby and the price is quite reasonable (but if you want a luxury hotel, it's not for you).

We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights in October 2005. It has a great location with all the main attractions in walking distance. The nearest subway station and Tim Hortons coffee shop are also within one minute's walk.
reviews.title: Excellent location!

reviews.text: I would say the intersection of Dundas and Yonge Streets is the heart of Toronto! and this is what I could see from my window at the hotel, just one block away from Eaton Centre. The rooms are small, but clean, everything good quality, many people from different countries stay at this hotel so it feels like the UN. The small restaurant downstairs is OK (is like a nice dinner kind of thing), but being so centrally located, is better eating out.
reviews.title: Friendly, clean ... perfect location !

reviews.text: HI we stayed at the bond for 7 nights from 27th september, found all the staff friendly ,special mention to donna who was great fun , very helpfull getting tickets ,tours ect
reviews.title: good value, great location

reviews.text: The location as all been said before is great downtown to air canada center, harbour area 20 mins cn tower skydome a bit further to walk, dundas subway close to hotel enter at eaton center 5 mins walk from hotel.
reviews.title: Good location, drab rooms

reviews.text: Rooms were on the small side but very clean, great value for money this hotel, save your money go here , use the money saved over other hotels to treat yourself lol:-) will use his hotel when next return to toronto
reviews.title: freindly and clean

reviews.text: Great location and not expensive but the decor is that horrible brown colour and the rooms are a bit shabby. The service was good though.
reviews.title: Not Impressed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had been planning a trip to Toronto for the WinterCity festival for the end of January.
reviews.title: Spacious...for a broom closet
Great value for money
reviews.text: When searching for hotels we found the location of the Bond Place to meet our needs being right in the heart of Dundas Square. This provided easy access to the Canon Theatre, Eaton Centre, and the Air Canada Centre.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon arrival, the location was excellent. However, that was the only thing this hotel had going for it. We arrived at our room to find two single beds(if they were even that big - my feet were hanging off the end by a good 4-5" and I am only 5'10") in the smallest room we have ever stayed in.
reviews.title: Tired but excellent value

reviews.text: We had a lovely view of a construction site which was outside our room. However, I think the construction workers enjoyed the view more as we constantly felt their stares forcing us to close the blinds.
reviews.title: Perfect For Students

likes.disliked: — Can't complain for that low a price!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We decided we would make the best of things and we could deal with the cramp space if we spent as little time in the room as possible. We set out on the town...returning around 10:30 pm. Tired after a long day of walking, we decided to relax and watch television. Well, the remote didn't work and after about five minutes of watching television the picture froze with John Stossel from 20/20 repeating the same sentence over (Doesnt it make you angry when..doesnt it make you angry when...) and over again for 5 minutes with his face alternating between pink and green. At this point, I climbed out of bed, turned off the television, and began counting the hours until we were awake and checking out.
reviews.title: Fab location

reviews.text: Ok first things first, this isn't a luxury hotel. It doesn't boast olympic sized swimming pools, amazing views or anything else associated with hotels of a higher and more expensive calibre.
reviews.title: Great for exploring
Not really good
reviews.text: What this hotel does offer is a small but comfortable room for a great price in an amazing location. Myself and a friend spent a week here last October and it provides the perfect base for getting out and exploring Toronto.

reviews.title: Grotty
reviews.text: The rooms were small but efficient, cleaned and serviced daily and were on the whole of a very acceptable standard coming equipped with cable tv, air conditioning and all the normal hotel room facilities. Staff were helpful and a travellers cheque cashing and concierge service was available at reception.

reviews.title: GREAT Hotel
reviews.text: For the budget traveller this is an ideal choice for a base in Toronto
If you stay in this hotel, there is only one advantage, the great location!! The hotel is not very clean, is old and some people of the staff are rude.
reviews.title: A good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed one night from Dec.8 to the 9th. We were in a smoking room on the 17th floor. Clean beds and clean bathrooms. The only problem was a couple fighting in the next room, but the hotel can hardly be faulted for that. The view out the window was awesome, Toronto is such a beautiful city.
reviews.title: Bond Place Hotel = go0d deal

reviews.text: We were a bit leery about the place at first because it was relatively inexpensive and right downtown, but it turned out to be a great deal.
reviews.title: Good hotel overall

reviews.text: The Bond Place Hotel is fabulously located in downtown Toronto, on a streetcar line and a block from the Yonge Street subway. Decent sized rooms and helpful front desk staff were a plus. Although housekeeping "forgot" to visit our room one day and there is a charge for wireless internet access (steal it from the pub across the street instead), the location more than made up for these drawbacks.
reviews.title: Serviceable, Great Location!!

likes.liked: — Excellent location to all of downtown Toronto

reviews.title: great service for the price
reviews.text: The location of this hotel is terrific. Only steps from a subway transfer spot and all the shopping you could want. The room I stayed in was on the small side, so if you are planning to stay in your room, maybe this is not the hotel for you. The property needed some improvements, but it wasn't too bad. Pretty clean, but it would have been nice to have an extra blanket as opposed to pillows. The heating had a blower function that you had to manually switch on and off, otherwise it was too hot/too cold. They didn't offer a free breakfast, but if you do your homework like I did, you can find plenty of places around close, like the The Pickle Barrel in Atrium on Bay or The Senator on Victoria. If you need a place to sleep only, this may be your best bet.
This hotel is great value for the price not only for the facilities but the staff are great and offer 110% service.
reviews.title: Clean, Central and Basic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We managed to get a great deal on this hotel (3 nights for the price of 2), and to be honest had this one pegged as our budget choice and therefore the one that we we expecting to be the least nicest. I must say that we were pleasantly surprised with the overall standard of the hotel and the service given.
reviews.title: Cheap and cheerful - no problems to report

reviews.text: Check in itself was efficient and friendly. The room was adequate in size and clean enough with an average sized bathroom.
reviews.title: Well-priced basic hotel in central location

reviews.text: Outside of the room some of the public areas were a little tatty and run down. The corridors and the areas around the ice machines could have done with a good scrub, but to be honest who sleeps in the corridor?
reviews.title: Great value, nice location
Bond Hotel a wonderful find
reviews.text: The hotel could not have been in a better location. The centre of Toronto was literally a 2 minute walk. The Eaton Centre, the PATH and all transportation was only a stones throw away.

If on a budget again i would not hesitate to stay in this hotel in future. I must say that we found Toronto to be rather dull and lacking in must- see sights. The nightlife was the least exciting i have encountered in any major city. Gimme Montreal any day of the week.
reviews.title: Good Value, Great Location, Small rooms!

likes.liked: — Cheap! Great location near Yonge Street.
likes.disliked: — Small rooms and only double beds

reviews.text: We stayed here for the first four days of our trip to Toronto on 17th August 2005. The hotel is close to the central bus station and is easy to find. There is also a shuttle bus from the airport that goes downtown and stops at all the hotels. It leaves every half hour and is $15.50 one way. Our room was clean but small and the only complaint I have is that we were given a room at the back of the hotel and the fans for the air conditioning were quite noisey during the day and night but other than that we would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to anyone who wants to be close to the shops/restaurants and the local bus stops for tours of the city. [Recommend the grayline hop on hop off - we used this to travel around the town during the day] We could not fault the hotel staff as they were courteous, efficient and approachable with many questions! we actually booked this hotel because of all the good reviews on this site. If you want clean affordable accommodation this is the place for you.
reviews.title: Bond Place Hotel

reviews.text: I stayed at the Bond Place in Toronto for 7 nights and found it to be an excellent hotel. It was my first trip to Canada and the Hotel was booked through United Vacations. I have read some bad reviews about staff and reservation problems, but I didn't experience any. I found the staff could have been a little friendlier, but i guess it wasn't too bad.
reviews.title: Great little hotel

reviews.text: The location of the Hotel is excellent, especially with one of my favorite sandwich places, Subway, right across the street. :)
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: The room was suitably sized for me, not too big but not too small either. Standard Cable in the room and all usual stuff. The bathroom was well looked after with the best shower I've ever used. The pressure was excellent, in fact, too sore to use at full pressure. Excellent.
reviews.title: Had a Great Stay
Great location and amenities for those on a budget
reviews.text: The view from the window wasn't great as it faced away from downtown, but you don't really pay for a view, do you? There were a few dodgy people hanging around outside in the neighbourhood at night and we witness suspect people sneaking into the hotel and being removed by the manager which made me worry about security but we used a safety deposit box at reception and the door had a safety chian which helped.

My fiance and I stayed at the Bond Place Hotel during Easter weekend and it was good. The room was adequate, clean, and quiet as it was on a corner of the building. The hotel is very close to the Eaton Shopping Centre and subway, and the Airport Express shuttle stops right outside. There are many places to eat within a short walking distance and we ate breakfast in the restaurant one morning... omelet was greasy but the service was pleasant. It wasn't flashy but when you try to keep the expenses down some sacrifices need to be made! Would recommend to other travellers on a budget.
reviews.title: You get what you pay for!

reviews.text: I stayed here for 3 days in April 2006.
reviews.title: helped me 'Bond' with Toronto
Nothing wrong at all
reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised with the interior of the hotel as well as the location of the hotel, which is excellent and just steps away from the Eaton Centre, Yoong Street and a 15 minute walk from the excellent sports stadia (air canada - Ice Hockey/Basketball, and Rogers Centre - Baseball) and CN Tower.

The rooms were very well kept although maybe a bit on the small side if you do enjoy spending a litle time in the room. I was impressed with the selection of TV Channels in the room. The staff were very very friendly. I can't see anyone having any problems at this hotel. It seems to be very professionally run. I would return, no doubt at all.
reviews.title: Breakfast???!!?!?
A Super Time!
reviews.text: There is a restaurant downstairs and a nicely sized foyer. Although the menu is limited, the usual breakfast choices of French Toast, Eggs, Pancakes etc were good enough for me.
Booked my stay in this hotel through Cityandshow.com where they had a very good deal. I chose this hotel on location and price and was not left disappointed!!
reviews.title: Don't overlook this one!

reviews.text: The Airport Express bus took me straight outside the door, and upon entering the hotel's reception, I was greeted with a smile and a welcoming look. The staff always made you feel welcome and felt as if you did have a problem, then it would be sorted!
reviews.title: city break couldnt have been better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was basic, but very, very clean. You are literally a minutes walk from the closest subway station (Dundas) and the famous Eaton Centre. The hotel's restaurant was clean and the food was very nice and affordable.
reviews.title: Great location, great staff, great hotel!!

likes.disliked: — had to pay for wirless internet use

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I don't think I could praise this anymore, as a hotel can make or break a trip/holiday, and I had an amazing experience, so I would recommend this every time.
reviews.title: Great location at a great price!

likes.liked: — Unbeatable downtown location and great value pricing
likes.disliked: — Couldn't complain about anything for the price

reviews.text: During a visit to a friend in toronto, we decided to catch the musical we will rock you in toronto. as we stayed approx 1 hr away from toronto city centre we booked this little hotel for a 2 night stay.
reviews.title: Had a great stay at Bond Place

reviews.text: Not as classy or stylish as the British Spy but it still gets the job done.
reviews.title: The name is Bond...Bond Place Hotel
Good value
reviews.text: As other reviewers has already mentioned, the hotel is within walking distance of Eaton Shopping Centre (this place is massive), Yonge Street and the Dundas Street Subway.

The Entertainment District, Chinatown, CN Tower, Skydome and Air Canada Centre is about 20 minutes walk away but the flat, grid pattern streets of Toronto makes it easy to walk to. And the other suburbs of Toronto such as Greektown, Little India and Little Portugal are easily accessible by the TTC (Toronto's Public Transport).
reviews.title: Good Value Budget Hotel, Great Location

reviews.text: The hotel is very basic with roomy accomodation, clean amenities and comfortable beds. We had the breakfast special (booked directly through the hotel's website) and enjoyed lovely pancakes, bacon and eggs and fruit juices all served by the friendly and cheerful restaurant staff. Check in staff were very helpful and very courteous.
reviews.title: perfect on a budget in the heart of T.O.
excellent value
reviews.text: Highly recommend this hotel if you want to be in the experience the T Dot Oh!

description: The Bond Place Hotel Downtown Toronto is ideally located in the heart of downtown Toronto at Yonge and Dundas Square. The Hotel is across the street from the Eaton Centre and steps away from the Toronto Theatre District, including the Canon Theatre, Massey Hall, Elgin/Winter Garden Theatre, The Panasonic Theatre, and other local area attractions. Many downtown corporate and government offices, colleges and universities, are within walking distance. The Hotel is also central to downtown Toronto hospitals, with St. Michael's Hospital located across the street.
